name: Linux Server Hardening
description: Security checklist for hardening Linux servers based on CIS benchmarks

items.title: Ensure filesystem integrity is regularly checked
items.description: Implement and run file integrity monitoring tools regularly to ensure the integrity of critical system files.

items.title: Ensure permissions on /etc/passwd are configured
items.description: The /etc/passwd file contains user account information and should have appropriate permissions to prevent unauthorized access.

items.title: Ensure SSH root login is disabled
items.description: Root login should be disabled to prevent direct root access via SSH.

items.title: Ensure password expiration is 90 days or less
items.description: Password expiration should be set to ensure that passwords are changed regularly.

items.title: Ensure firewall is enabled and properly configured
items.description: A properly configured firewall is essential for system security.

items.title: Ensure unnecessary services are disabled
items.description: Disable all services that are not required to reduce the attack surface.

items.title: Ensure auditd is installed and enabled
items.description: The audit daemon should be enabled to collect and store audit information.

items.title: Ensure core dumps are restricted
items.description: Core dumps can contain sensitive information and should be restricted.

items.title: Ensure SELinux or AppArmor is installed and enabled
items.description: Mandatory Access Control systems like SELinux or AppArmor provide an additional layer of security.

items.title: Ensure updates are installed regularly
items.description: Regular updates ensure that security patches are applied promptly.
